Interface Bin

All Known Implementing Classes:
Binary
public interface Bin

Class that represents Binary numbers and operations.

Version:
6-19-04
Author:
Kyle Gillette

Method Summary
 Binary add(Binary rhs)
          Returns the sum of two binary numbers.
 Binary and(Binary rhs)
          Returns the bitwise and representation of two binary numbers ( 1 or 1 -> 1, 1 or 0 -> 0, 0 or 1 -> 0, 0 or 0 -> 0.)
 int bin2int()
          Returns the decimal value of the current Binary number.
 Binary int2bin(int num)
          Returns the Binary number that is equivalent to the integer number given.
 Binary not()
          Returns the bitwise not representation of a binary number (1s become 0s and 0s become 1s.)
 Binary or(Binary rhs)
          Returns the bitwise or representation of two binary numbers ( 1 or 1 -> 1, 1 or 0 -> 1, 0 or 1 -> 1, 0 or 0 -> 0.)
 Binary rotateLeft()
          Returns the representation of a binary number where each bit has been move to the left one position ( a 0 is put in the rightmost position.)
 Binary rotateRight()
          Returns the representation of a binary number where each bit has been move to the right one position ( a 0 is put in the leftmost position.)
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns the String representation of a binary number.
 Binary twosComplement()
          Returns the additive inverse value of the current Binary number (equivalent to multiplying by -1 .)

add

public Binary add(Binary rhs)
Returns the sum of two binary numbers.

Parameters:
rhs - the Binary number being added.
Returns:
the sum of two binary numbers.

public Binary and(Binary rhs)
Returns the bitwise and representation of two binary numbers ( 1 or 1 -> 1, 1 or 0 -> 0, 0 or 1 -> 0, 0 or 0 -> 0.)

Parameters:
rhs - the Binary number being and'd.
Returns:
the bitwise and representation of two binary numbers.

bin2int

public int bin2int()
Returns the decimal value of the current Binary number.

Returns:

int2bin

public Binary int2bin(int num)
Returns the Binary number that is equivalent to the integer number given.

Parameters:
num - the decimal number to be converted to Binary.
Returns:
the converted Binary number.

not

public Binary not()
Returns the bitwise not representation of a binary number (1s become 0s and 0s become 1s.)

Returns:
the bitwise not representation of a binary number.

or

public Binary or(Binary rhs)
Returns the bitwise or representation of two binary numbers ( 1 or 1 -> 1, 1 or 0 -> 1, 0 or 1 -> 1, 0 or 0 -> 0.)

Parameters:
rhs - the Binary number being or'd.
Returns:
the bitwise or representation of two binary numbers.

rotateLeft

public Binary rotateLeft()
Returns the representation of a binary number where each bit has been move to the left one position ( a 0 is put in the rightmost position.)

Returns:
the representation of a binary number whose bits have been rotated left.

rotateRight

public Binary rotateRight()
Returns the representation of a binary number where each bit has been move to the right one position ( a 0 is put in the leftmost position.)

Returns:
the representation of a binary number whose bits have been rotated right.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the String representation of a binary number.

Returns:
the String representation of a binary number.

twosComplement

public Binary twosComplement()
Returns the additive inverse value of the current Binary number (equivalent to multiplying by -1 .)

Returns:
the additive inverse value of the current Binary number.
